tweets.text: We have seen evidence of this around the Humber. If you are having a clear-out, please check to make sure the company you are using has the correct licenses. Quick, easy and could save you a hefty fine! https://t.co/yFWNcWYz7v

@andybarr911 @RUready4Wood @VerValleySoc @Feargal_Sharkey @RV_environment @EnvAgency Was down there for rare visit this summer and was shocked at how dried out the Meon river bed was - and overgrown in a way that showed this was a new norm.  Yes, it occasionally dried out at the East Meon end but not in the meadows by the A32 heading out of West Meon.

Some easy things you can look into during Flood Resilience Awareness Week to be more prepared for flooding are to: 
🔵 check your flood risk
🔵 sign up to @EnvAgencyNW flood warnings
🔵 create a flood plan
🔵 create a flood kit 

Give @TheFloodHub a follow for some more tips! https://t.co/up4AhheQHW
So very proud to be part of this project! https://t.co/8vTQLLq8Wp
@VotePursglove @fletty1974 @CorbyBC @mycountycouncil @EnvAgencyMids Cheers Tom, told you Boba he’s get back to us! 👍🏻

tweets.text:
In light of British rivers failing their pollution tests, it is revealed that farmers receive a pollution inspection from @EnvAgency every 263 yrs...

Read more 👉 https://t.co/2usKjejarE

A pair of beavers on Spains Hall Estate have built over a dozen dams, holding up almost 2 Olympic swimming pools of water!

Manager and owner Archie Ruggles-Brise tells us how these busy beavers are a nature-based solution to flood management #NatureForLife #UNGA https://t.co/uWhaqBEvLw

Sun 27th Sept is #WorldRiversDay A recent report from @EnvAgency showed only 14% of English Rivers are ecologically healthy.

Which is your local river? How could you get to know it better? What could you do to support it?

#ActsOfRiverKindness image: @jamesaldridge4 https://t.co/rKlUQOBnYy

tweets.text:
Enforcement teams are working across Greater Manchester to monitor flytipping and they will investigate and prosecute where appropriate. 

Please help us keep Salford clean, report fly tipping if you see it!  
https://t.co/cH1uHL7OWV
 
#SCRAPFlytipping @recycle4gm @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/bHfOw8yXpt

urls.title: Report fly-tipping or illegal waste dumping
urls.description: Fly-tipping is the illegal dumping of waste or rubbish - report it to the local council or to Crimestoppers

tweets.text: Today we let the water through our first completed #FishPassage the RiverSevern 🙌 #LetItFlow #FishPassage @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup https://t.co/DvPy25LSuh

Week 1 of our @HeritageFundUK  #RiverWitham project complete and we're already seeing the return of the 'wiggle' 😍  Improving flow diversity and creating more varied habitat for all river dwellers 🐟🦆🦦😀📷David Martin @Lions12020253 @EnvAgencyMids @WithamSlea @southkesteven https://t.co/GlMikT2sSB

"Total to stop oil refining at Grandpuits in 1Q 2021". ...and start a 400 ktpa biorefinery! And a 100 ktpa PLA plant. 2024. Finally the bio-century is dawning. Go ahead Europe - we need it urgently! Go for materials, not fuels!!! https://t.co/JjHtPgRIJJ

We spend 1000s of days & work on 100s of km of river per year so we see a thing or two!
This experience has shaped our response to @EnvAgency Challenges & Choices
Read it here: https://t.co/GWoflFUR5M
#WTTNews

tweets.text:
Outdoor Use Of Metaldehyde To Be Banned To Protect Wildlife #Metaldehyde #Farming #ProtectWildlife #SaveTheEnvironment @H_S_E @SoilAssociation @EnvAgency
https://t.co/ZbknbVlY0Q

@DaveThroupEA @HfdsCouncil @WUFoundation @YourHereford1 I wish letters would go to all farmers across pastoral UK reminding them of farming rules for water and telling them spreading slurry on harvested maize fields in winter, often February is NOT, permitted. It's a standard practice here. @EnvAgencySW

Project to re-naturalise 650m of Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood on track. Narrowed channel = increased water velocity = cleansed gravel bed (4th photo) Funded by EA and ERDF https://t.co/sdweOZi0gu @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @Team4Nature @WKWT @LoveSolihull @SolihullUpdates https://t.co/ha4cVG5rc7

urls.title: Home - Wildlife Ways
urls.description: Wildlife Ways is a £16.8 million programme, part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF), to improve Solihull borough for the benefit of people and wildlife. It will include tree, bulb and wildflower planting and make it easier for people wanting to walk and cycle by widening and connecting paths and cycle routes with green spaces.

annotations.normalized_text: 650m of Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood

tweets.text:
Found some #Aire white clawed #crayfish today.... but unfortunately all were dead. Not plague. 
Thanks @EnvAgencyYNE for quick, efficient response. 
Upper Aire Project #UAP site improving instream & riparian habitat to benefit these natives as well as trout et al @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/JqdDZON6tE

Thread 1/4

Letter currently being sent to 1200 farmers and land managers in the Lugg catchment #herefordshire reminding them of their legal responsibilities and asking for their help in reducing phosphate levels in local rivers. https://t.co/ECPTsMpy8O
@NickMott7 @TheTrentValley @StaffsWildlife @AquaUoS @RRC @EnvAgencyMids @ECRRnetwork Impressive Nick! When can we see it?

New figures from @EnvAgency  reveal that 0% of river, lakes and streams are classed as in good health in England! 

In 2016, 16% of waters were classed as good - shocking to see how badly we have failed to protect and restore our environment in England

@awojulu @followlasg @jidesanwoolu @channelstv @TVCconnect @NTANewsNow @PoliceNG @MobilePunch @AIT_Online @FMEnvng @nairaland @Fmohnigeria @UNEP @EnvAgency @sejorg @saferphones @MoHFW_INDIA LASE WAT? * No English river met @EnvAgency quality tests for pollution
* Only 14% are of "good ecological standard"
